intro: Pelexia wendlandiana, commonly known as Wendland's pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many familiar bell-shaped flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
